trial_identification.studytitle: Arterial stiffness in systemic inflammatory disease
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Arterial stiffness in systemic inflammatory disease (observational case-control study)

conditions.healthcondition: systemic inflammatory disease ( e.g. systemic lupus erythematodes, periaortits )

interventions.interventions: Evaluation of vascular risk markers in different study populations (cross-sectional case-control design) duration: 1 year methods: arterial stiffness measured by pulse wave velocity; arterial blood pressure measured by spygnomanometry; evaluation of cardiovascular risk factors (e.g. laboratory serum parameters like cholesterol, glycated hemiglobin and clinical assessment)

primaryOutcome.outcome: arterial stiffness measured by pulse wave velocity

secondaryOutcome.outcome: -evaluation of cardiovascular risk factors (e.g. laboratory serum parameters like cholesterol, glycated hemiglobin tools: patient data information concering previous cardiovascular disease, smoking habits
endothelial dysfunction test e.g. serum markers ( Assymmetric dimethylarginine)
arterial hypertension measured by automatic sphygnomanometry
evaluation of cardiovascular risk factors (clinical assessment, medical tests)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- patients with active or chronic systemic inflammatory disease
- or patients arterial hypertension for more than 5 years
- healthy persons
- written informed consent
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- cardiac arrhythmia
- patients / persons < 18 years of age
- women with a known pregancy

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Evaluation of vascular risk markers in patients with systemic inflammation like patients with periaortitis or lupus in comparision to patients with and without arterial hypertension
